text:
Maria Koterbska (13 July 1924 – 18 January 2021) was a Polish singer. She was popular in the 1950s and 1960s. She was born in Bielsko, Poland.
In 1999, Koterbska was awarded the Officer's Cross of the Order of Polonia Restituta.
Koterbska was known for her singles were "Augustowskie noce", "Brzydula i rudzielec", "Karuzela", "Parasolki", "Serduszko puka w rytmie cza cza", "Wrocławska piosenka" and "Do grającej szafy grosik wrzuć".
Koterbska died in Bielsko-Biała, Poland on 18 January 2021 at the age of 96.
